page.title: 12Attitudes, The Narth
page.content: A survey of attitudes to village life was carried out among 12 villagers of The Narth. It revealed that most of the participants had lived here for 10 years or more. No-one minded newcomers moving into the village, half welcomed it. The village has changed in recent years with the in-filling of plots of land with high quality housing. Most of the people questioned enjoyed attending activities organised in the village such as dances, flower arranging, and keep fit classes. Eleven wanted a recreation area and one didn't know. Probably these people all had children who could use it. The majority believed a cottage industry should be introduced to the area. Suggestions to improve village life included the provision of a play area, larger shop and more community spirit.
